newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-PHILIPS ENDS CHAMPIONS LEAGUE SPONSORSHIP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PHILIPS ENDS CHAMPIONS LEAGUE SPONSORSHIP.

text.p: Dutch electronics group Philips Electronics said on Wednesday it would not renew its contract to sponsor the European Champions League.
Spokesman Ben Geerts said the company's three-year sponsorship contract was expiring this season and it would not sign a new contract starting next season.
"The reason is that we are reviewing our advertising mix and sponsorship is part of that budget," he told Reuters.
He declined to specify the value of the deal, adding that estimates of 8-10 million guilders ($4.3-5.3 million) per year mentioned in Dutch media reports were too high.
Geerts also denied reports that Philips was pulling out because the sponsorship package was too expensive.
"It's a matter of priorities," he said.
But he said the company would still sponsor the 1998 World Cup in France. $=Dfl1.88
